content.text: The MCP resources are only for Effect docs. Let me check the actual directory structure to understand how the issue system works:

content.content:
1→//! OpenAgents - Unified CLI and Desktop Application
     2→//!
     3→//! Single binary that provides:
     4→//! - GUI by default (tabbed view of all apps)
     5→//! - CLI subcommands for all functionality:
     6→//!   - `openagents wallet ...`
     7→//!   - `openagents marketplace ...`
     8→//!   - `openagents autopilot ...`
     9→//!   - `openagents gitafter ...`
    10→//!   - `openagents daemon ...`
    11→
    12→use clap::{Parser, Subcommand};
    13→use std::process;
    14→
    15→mod cli;
    16→mod gui;
    17→
    18→#[derive(Parser)]
    19→#[command(name = "openagents")]
    20→#[command(version, about = "OpenAgents - Unified desktop application and CLI", long_about = None)]
    21→struct Cli {
    22→    #[command(subcommand)]
    23→    command: Option<Commands>,
    24→
    25→    /// Enable verbose logging
    26→    #[arg(short, long, global = true)]
    27→    verbose: bool,
    28→}
    29→
    30→#[derive(Subcommand)]
    31→enum Commands {
    32→    /// Wallet commands (identity, payments)
    33→    #[command(subcommand)]
    34→    Wallet(cli::wallet::WalletCommands),
    35→
    36→    /// Marketplace commands (compute, skills, data, trajectories)
    37→    #[command(subcommand)]
    38→    Marketplace(cli::marketplace::MarketplaceCommands),
    39→
    40→    /// Autopilot commands (autonomous task runner)
    41→    #[command(subcommand)]
    42→    Autopilot(cli::autopilot::AutopilotCommands),
    43→
    44→    /// GitAfter commands (Nostr-native git)
    45→    #[command(subcommand)]
    46→    Gitafter(cli::gitafter::GitafterCommands),
    47→
    48→    /// Daemon commands (background supervisor)
    49→    #[command(subcommand)]
    50→    Daemon(cli::daemon::DaemonCommands),
    51→}
    52→
    53→fn main() {
    54→    let cli = Cli::parse();
    55→
    56→    // Initialize logging
    57→    let log_level = if cli.verbose { "debug" } else { "info" };
    58→    tracing_subscriber::fmt()
    59→        .with_env_filter(
    60→            tracing_subscriber::EnvFilter::try_from_default_env()
    61→                .unwrap_or_else(|_| tracing_subscriber::EnvFilter::new(log_level)),
    62→        )
    63→        .init();
    64→
    65→    // Run command
    66→    let result = match cli.command {
    67→        None => gui::run(),
    68→        Some(Commands::Wallet(cmd)) => cli::wallet::run(cmd),
    69→        Some(Commands::Marketplace(cmd)) => cli::marketplace::run(cmd),
    70→        Some(Commands::Autopilot(cmd)) => cli::autopilot::run(cmd),
    71→        Some(Commands::Gitafter(cmd)) => cli::gitafter::run(cmd),
    72→        Some(Commands::Daemon(cmd)) => cli::daemon::run(cmd),
    73→    };
    74→
    75→    if let Err(e) = result {
    76→        eprintln!("Error: {}", e);
    77→        process::exit(1);
    78→    }
    79→}
    80→

<system-reminder>

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.text: I see that the issue commands are defined but not implemented in the unified binary yet. Let me check the autopilot crate directly:

input.command: sqlite3 autopilot.db "SELECT id, title, status FROM issues WHERE status = 'ready' ORDER BY priority DESC, created_at ASC LIMIT 1"
input.description: Query next ready issue from database
